body.p: To the Excellance of Thos E Bramblette Gov of Ky

I take this Method of leting you know the condition of the Recruiting operation here as you will see from the pattiton sent to you by the citizens of this place that we want A commander here I. had thout of going to see you my self but concluded to write to you and Remain here til I could here from you if the plan propose by the citizens in this patition does not a meet youre approval I would be very glad if you would asign me A position some whare Els in the army as I cant stay at home on account of the gurillers I have spent a great deal of time and money in the Recruiting Servis I would like very mutch as I cant stay at home to have Some place that I could make my expences

I would greatly prefer working here as I am well acquainted with the country and I think if you give me command of those troops I can make a Respectable command of them I am sure I can controle them and make them good soldiers

sir I have the honor
to be youre obedient Servant
J. L Woodward
To the Governor desiring to be placed in command of all the troops in and around Owensboro

Answered. Aug. 5th 1864 on letter book B. Page 17
Recd A. G O. 5th Aug 1864
